title: silverlight compile to html5 or Have XAML run in browser without plugin
body: have Silverlight compile to html5 or Have XAML run in browser without plugin.

comments.body:
I've just built a service named http://xaml2html.net to address (partly) this need.
Feedback is most welcome!

MS has decided to kick all its loyal XAML devs' a$$es, and favorite HTML-CSS-JS over CS-XAML. HCJ are hardcoded languages and evil. I'm waiting for the day MS brings back Silverlight+RIA services as plugin free, via compiling to HCJ.

I think it would be great but , I think it will be better to compile to famo.us framework, I already migrating to it it's cool but it's lake of declarative way of descriping your UI,and it have integration with angular.js
If Silverlight Xaml can be combiles to Famo.us it will be awesome and work with typeScript
http://famo.us/
https://famo.us/integrations/angular/#/intro
example
http://disrupt.famo.us/periodic402/

I could totally see this done using a combination of WebGL, emscripten/asm.js where the Silverlight code is complied right down to something that modern browsers could consume directly.  They have shown some awesome demos using the Unity and Unreal engine so why not the Silverlight one?

A new Visual Studio extension named "C#/XAML for HTML5" has been released that attempts to do just that (to have Silverlight compile to html5 by converting C#/XAML to cross-platform HTML5/JS/CSS that runs on all browsers without plugins):
http://www.cshtml5.com

I think it is too hard to do this.
first, how to change the control template to html5?
second is the data binding, but now we have some js library to do this.
the last is how to change a lot of codes and library to js.(I mean just like "string.IsEmpty")
One step at a time. I think TypeScript specification should be augmented with structures that ease the conversion of XAML to HTML5 / Javascript.

There is someone who is trying to do this
http://fayde.wsick.com/

What I don't get then is if you just support IE only (you're not worried about cross browser stuff) then why hassle with anything other than WPF? Or really XAML Apps?
Of course I am coming form the opinion that ASP.NET and all that is a hassle and just not as easy to deal with as basically desktop based code. For Windows 8.1 and beyond then you really start having some nice options for Phone/Tablet/Desktop compatible solutions.
I don't know really.... someone tell me why I'd want to do anything else....
What is the least appealing to me is the script stuff. Seems like an unwieldy thing when it gets big....
Is that because it is so loosely structured, and the lack of strong typing that to me it seems that way?
I vote yes. I have thought something like that would be in the pipe-line from t he get-go.

Interesting. I had a similar idea and I posted it as follows:
I suggest Microsoft create a project template for XAML/Typescript and not just HTML/Typescript with the following three items in mind:

This could be in a similar way as TypeScript.
TypeScript is a superset of javascript ... type safe and compiled to JS language.
There is nothing wrong with JavaScript. People just need to learn the language before they try and write applications in it.
Anyone please vote here as well: http://dotnet.uservoice.com/forums/4325-silverlight-feature-suggestions/suggestions/1713161-compile-silverlight-to-html5-css3-and-javascript-

I think having a 'compiler' that generates Silverlight code into HTML5+CSS3+JS code would be awesome, I think it's even worth throwing away some existing SL features to make the generator compatible with HTML5+CSS3+JS.
It's not a secret, even many devs use it a lot, JavaScript is a stinky error-prone language. Having C#+XAML generated to H+C+J would be extremely great.
I'd also like my Windows 8 Metro applications to work on a Commodore 64. Could you guys get on that? Thanks.

To Jeremy Pardoe
* What about offline systems with restricted and tight security policy that disable any plugins (like flash, Sl, ....) only HTML and JS are allowed.
* What about mobile and tablets customers (I'm working in a central bank; the top management uses IPad only)...
* What about other banks, FX companies and other organizations that access your applications.
....

I just wonder how naive you can be to ask for XAML being able to run in browser without plugin. And lets say that Microsoft implements such a feature for their Internet Explorer, why don't you go to Mozilla, Google, Apple etc to ask them do the same for their browsers !
